page.title: 16Housing
page.content: In the north-west of the area is the centre of Ilkeston, composed of mainly Victorian and early 20th century housing. Portions have been demolished for re-development. This area is surrounded by an area of early 20th century terraced and semi-detached houses which merge into Victorian mansions and large 1920 & 30's housing, and up-to-date housing. These areas separate Ilkeston from Kirk Hallam and here is the oldest house we found, Jacobean, Little Hallam Hall. Kirk Hallam is mainly estate housing, private and council built, a mixture of terraced, semi- and detached buildings, including old people's bungalows and 3 storey blocks of flats. Many council houses are passing into private ownership. Through the estate is a ribbon of older houses round the church.
